title: Man Utd injury news: Paul Pogba out of Liverpool clash, could be sidelined until November
text:
Paul Pogba has been playing through the pain barrier for Manchester United (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United fear Paul Pogba will be sidelined with a foot injury until at least November.

The midfielder missed United’s defeat at Newcastle before the international break and the Frenchman was targeting a return for the side’s clash against Liverpool at Old Trafford next Sunday.

Pogba uploaded a video onto his official Instagram account yesterday detailing his progress and revealing he was ‘almost there’.

However, the Daily Mail report he will not be fit for the game against Liverpool and is facing at least another two to three weeks out.

United hope to have Aaron Wan-Bissaka available again after the defender missed the previous two matches through illness.

Jesse Lingard is expected to be unavailable as he recovers from a hamstring injury, while Anthony Martial is still not 100% after sustaining a groin strain in late August.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Victor Lindelof is available again after missing the defeat against Newcastle with a back injury.
